page.title: 11CRICKET IN WIS. GREEN
page.content: Each weekend in summer cricket is played on the village green.The village has two men's teams and a junior team. There are eleven men in each team.Before the match they decide who's batting and who's fielding. The scorer sets out the batting and bowling order. If a person is out, they put what time out, how out, how many runs and who bowled. When the batsman hits a four, the umpire moves his arm across his chest and if he hits a six, the umpire puts both of his hands in the air. For a leg bye he hits his leg, for a wide he puts his arm out and for a no-ball he puts one arm in the air. The object of the game is to score as many runs as possible.
